channel.title: BBC News - Asia

item.title: China Covid: Concerns grow as Delta outbreak spreads
item.description: Authorities are carrying out mass testing and have imposed sweeping lockdowns across 15 provinces.

item.title: China flood death toll rises sharply to over 300
item.description: More victims are discovered following the severe floods that engulfed Henan province in July.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: India rejoices at women's hockey team's semi-final spot
item.description: India caused "the biggest upset of the tournament" after defeating Australia in the quarter-final.

item.title: Giant panda twins born in French zoo
item.description: The event is described as "exceptional" by experts, as panda reproduction is notoriously difficult.

item.title: Afterpay: Jack Dorsey's Square in Australia's biggest buyout
item.description: The $29bn deal for Afterpay will create an instalments payment giant in a hugely growing sector.

item.title: Olympic Games Tokyo 2020: India's big wins, misses and top medal hopes
item.description: India has won two medals - one silver and one bronze - at the Games.

item.title: How South Korea's migrant wives are breaking the glass ceiling
item.description: Many arrived not knowing the language, but are now carving out a significant place in society.

item.title: Afghanistan: Orphan's reunion with British soldier after 19 years
item.description: Ramin Paikar was among the orphans visited by British soldiers stationed in Kabul in 2002.

item.title: Afghanistan: Taliban continue attacks on three major cities
item.description: Fears rise of a humanitarian crisis as Islamist militants seek to take their first provincial capital.

item.title: Myanmar: State of emergency extended with coup leader as PM
item.description: Gen Min Aung Hlaing takes on the new title and says emergency rule may last until August 2023.

item.title: Sky News Australia barred for week by YouTube over Covid misinformation
item.description: The digital giant bans the channel from uploading new content for a week over misinformation breaches.

item.title: New Zealand Dawn Raids: Jacinda Ardern formally apologises
item.description: Jacinda Ardern says Pacific Islander communities still "suffer and carry the scars" from the policy.

item.title: Kris Wu: K-Pop star arrested on suspicion of rape
item.description: The Chinese-Canadian star denies allegations made online by several women in China.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Valerie Adams makes history with fourth shot put medal
item.description: New Zealand's Valerie Adams becomes the first woman to win medals at four Olympics in a field event after claiming bronze in the women's shot put.

item.title: Australia Covid: Brisbane lockdown after Delta variant cases
item.description: Millions of Australians in parts of Queensland enter a snap lockdown from Saturday afternoon.

item.title: Covid-19 pandemic: Japan widens emergency over 'frightening' spike
item.description: The Olympics host is facing record Covid case numbers, fuelled by the virulent Delta strain.

item.title: Nanjing: New virus outbreak worst since Wuhan, say Chinese state media
item.description: Almost 200 people have been infected since the virus was first detected at Nanjing airport on 20 July.

item.title: Weightlifter at the centre of sport's transgender debate
item.description: Weightlifter Laurel Hubbard is set to become the first openly transgender athlete to compete in a different gender category to that which they were born at an Olympics.

item.title: India reptile park struggles to survive amid Covid
item.description: The future is uncertain for the thousands of snakes, lizards and crocodiles at the Guindy Snake Park.

item.title: From Afghan interpreter to US homeless - the long road to the American dream
item.description: Thousands of Afghan interpreters have waited years to flee to the US. Arriving is a different story.

item.title: 'Liberate Hong Kong': The slogan that will land you in jail
item.description: An eight-character phrase popularised during the protests has landed one man in jail for nine years.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: The medal winners' flowers that pay tribute to 2011 disaster
item.description: More than 5,000 bouquets are being handed to athletes at the Olympic and Paralympic Games - and have a special significance, with flowers from areas devastated by a 2011 earthquake and tsunami.

item.title: Olympics: The hidden sight of Tokyo's homeless
item.description: For many among Tokyo's homeless community the Olympics are far from a cause for celebration.

item.title: Kris Wu: Why a superstar sparked China's sexual consent debate
item.description: A growing rape allegation controversy centering on Kris Wu has renewed discussion on sexual consent.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: What's happening with Covid cases in Japan?
item.description: With the Olympics underway, more Covid cases continue to be reported at the Games and across Japan.

item.title: Mapping the advance of the Taliban in Afghanistan
item.description: Maps of Afghanistan show who controls districts in fighting between the government and Taliban forces.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Take a tour of the incredible venues
item.description: They range from an arena built by a father and son, to a legendary home of Japanese martial arts.

item.title: Archibald Prize: 100 years of Australia's top portrait honour
item.description: Over 100 years, the Archibald Prize has become better at reflecting Australian diversity.

item.title: The Indian girl killed for wearing jeans
item.description: Neha Paswan was allegedly beaten to death by relatives who disagreed with her choice of clothes.

item.title: Sandstorm swallows city in northwestern China
item.description: Dust clouds towered at least 100 metres (330ft) over Dunhuang.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: One athlete braved sharks and crocodiles
item.description: Training for the Olympics can be a full-time job but Jo Brigden-Jones has combined it with much more.

item.title: Afrobeats in Japan: British-Nigerian hip hop dancer teaching children how to dance
item.description: Yinka Oshiletu, a British-Nigerian hip hop dancer is bringing Afrobeats sounds to Japan's young dancers.

item.title: Why is the Great Barrier Reef in trouble? A simple guide
item.description: Australia's natural wonder faces a battle to survive - here's a simple guide.
